## Description {#details}

Adds Control Flow Guard (CFG) checks on indirect function calls/invokes.

These checks ensure that the target address corresponds to the start of an address-taken function. X86&#95;64 targets use the Mechanism::Dispatch mechanism. <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86">X86</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm">ARM</a>, and <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aarch64">AArch64</a> targets use the Mechanism::Check machanism.

Definition at line 40 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/cfguard/cfguard-cpp">CFGuard.cpp</a>.

### insertCFGuardCheck() {#ad7c5a4356eb729fe374f917da7435a12}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void CFGuardImpl::insertCFGuardCheck (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42; CB)</>}>
Inserts a Control Flow Guard (CFG) check on an indirect call using the CFG check mechanism.

When the image is loaded, the loader puts the appropriate guard check function pointer in the &#95;&#95;guard&#95;check&#95;icall&#95;fptr global symbol. This checks that the target address is a valid address-taken function. The address of the target function is passed to the guard check function in an architecture-specific register (e.g. ECX on 32-bit <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86">X86</a>, X15 on Aarch64, and R0 on <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm">ARM</a>). The guard check function has no return value (if the target is invalid, the guard check funtion will raise an error).

For example, the following LLVM IR: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%func&#95;ptr = alloca i32 ()&#42;, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">store i32 ()&#42; @target&#95;func, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%0 = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpumarklastscratchload-cpp/#a8a3fe89940744b94ffe5dacd6704c2be">load</a> i32 ()&#42;, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%1 = call i32 %0()</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

is transformed to: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%func&#95;ptr = alloca i32 ()&#42;, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">store i32 ()&#42; @target&#95;func, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%0 = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpumarklastscratchload-cpp/#a8a3fe89940744b94ffe5dacd6704c2be">load</a> i32 ()&#42;, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%1 = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpumarklastscratchload-cpp/#a8a3fe89940744b94ffe5dacd6704c2be">load</a> void (i8&#42;)&#42;, void (i8&#42;)&#42;&#42; @&#95;&#95;guard&#95;check&#95;icall&#95;fptr</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%2 = bitcast i32 ()&#42; %0 to i8&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">call cfguard&#95;checkcc </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> %1(i8&#42; %2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%3 = call i32 %0()</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

For example, the following <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86">X86</a> assembly code: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">movl  $&#95;target&#95;func, %eax</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">calll &#42;%eax</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

is transformed to: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">movl  $&#95;target&#95;func, %ecx</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">calll &#42;&#95;&#95;&#95;guard&#95;check&#95;icall&#95;fptr</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">calll &#42;%ecx</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="CB">indirect call to instrument.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/cfguard/cfguard-cpp/#l00099">99</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/cfguard/cfguard-cpp">CFGuard.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### insertCFGuardDispatch() {#a6817bdede4df5251b8422f22617be51f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void CFGuardImpl::insertCFGuardDispatch (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42; CB)</>}>
Inserts a Control Flow Guard (CFG) check on an indirect call using the CFG dispatch mechanism.

When the image is loaded, the loader puts the appropriate guard check function pointer in the &#95;&#95;guard&#95;dispatch&#95;icall&#95;fptr global symbol. This checks that the target address is a valid address-taken function and, if so, tail calls the target. The target address is passed in an architecture-specific register (e.g. RAX on X86&#95;64), with all other arguments for the target function passed as usual.

For example, the following LLVM IR: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%func&#95;ptr = alloca i32 ()&#42;, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">store i32 ()&#42; @target&#95;func, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%0 = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpumarklastscratchload-cpp/#a8a3fe89940744b94ffe5dacd6704c2be">load</a> i32 ()&#42;, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%1 = call i32 %0()</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

is transformed to: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%func&#95;ptr = alloca i32 ()&#42;, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">store i32 ()&#42; @target&#95;func, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%0 = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpumarklastscratchload-cpp/#a8a3fe89940744b94ffe5dacd6704c2be">load</a> i32 ()&#42;, i32 ()&#42;&#42; %func&#95;ptr, align 8</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%1 = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpumarklastscratchload-cpp/#a8a3fe89940744b94ffe5dacd6704c2be">load</a> i32 ()&#42;, i32 ()&#42;&#42; @&#95;&#95;guard&#95;dispatch&#95;icall&#95;fptr</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%2 = call i32 %1() &#91; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;cfguardtarget&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(i32 ()&#42; %0) &#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

For example, the following X86&#95;64 assembly code: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">leaq   target&#95;func(%rip), %rax</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">callq  &#42;%rax</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

is transformed to: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">leaq   target&#95;func(%rip), %rax</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">callq  &#42;&#95;&#95;guard&#95;dispatch&#95;icall&#95;fptr(%rip)</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="CB">indirect call to instrument.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/cfguard/cfguard-cpp/#l00140">140</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/cfguard/cfguard-cpp">CFGuard.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
